ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with comicbox 1.1.1 on 2024-03-13T21:49:36 [Issue ID 4000-161209] urn:comicvine:4000-161209 Tagged with ComicTagger 1.6.0a13.dev122 using info from Grand Comics Database on 2024-06-17 01:48:50. [Issue ID 348873]
ComicInfo.Summary: From the gangs of ancient India to the modern mafia, THE BIG BOOK OF THUGS offers a historical and insightful overview of the most notorious gangs and mobs since the beginning of time. Analyzing the infamous group dynamic, this enrossing book delves into the immoral actions and tainted motivations of these organized packs. But neither romanticizing nor condemning their actions, this black and white comic text is an accurate portrait of the toughest mobs ever to walk the mean streets and rule the back alleys.
ComicInfo.Title: Thuggees; The Bowery Boys; The Dead Rabbits; The Whyos; The Midnight Terrors!; The Crazy Butch Gang; The Molasses Gang; The Gangs of Old New York; Plug Uglies; Yellow Henry Gang; The Sydney Ducks; The Car Barn Gang; The Eastmans; The We Boys Mob; The Doane Gang; The Secret Band of Brothers; The Loomis Gang; Devil Ance and the Hatfield Gang; Mother Marm Mandelbaum; The White Family Gang; The Highbinder Society; Mock Duck & the Hip Sing Tong; The Valley Gang; Bully Wilson and the Cave-in Rock Pirates; The Swamp Angels; The Bayonne-Abriel Gang; Sadie the Goat and Her Pirate Gang; The Hook Gang; Railroad-Robbing Gangs; The White Hand Gang; The Doolin Gang; The Buck Gang; The Red Sash Gang; Old Man Harvey's Gang; The McCarty Gang; The Reynolds Gang; The Dodge City Peace Commission; The Black Jack Ketchum Gang; The McCanles Gang; The East Texas Regulator Gang; The Slickers: Spanking Vigilantes; The Stranglers; Regulators of the Carolinas; Tobacco Night Riders; The Hounds; American Protective League; The Mollie Maguires; Ragen's Colts; The Rich Men's Coachmen's Club; The Anarchist Bonnot; College Kidnappers Club; The Ohio Gang; The Bliss Bank Ring; The Brady Gang; The Bloody Tubs; Colonel Plug's River Rats
